Detailed Description

An Observable-Object can be observed by several instances of the class Observer. Whenever the state of an Observable-Object is changed, NotifyObservers() is invoked, which calls Observer::OnUpdate(this) for all attached Observers. Hence all Observers can react on the state-change of the Observable-Object.

Please be aware that this class is not designed to be and therefore never meant to be thread-safe! The invocation and execution of Observer::OnUpdate(this) for all attached Observers will be done by the execution context which invoked NotifyObservers()!!!

See also:
Observer

Member Function Documentation

void ObservableObject::Attach (  Observer *  observer  ) 
 

Attaches the Observer observer to the observer-list. For every attached observer Observer::OnUpdate(this) is invoked, whenever the state of the Observable-Object changes.

void ObservableObject::Detach (  Observer *  observer  ) 
 

Detaches the Observer observer from the observer-list.

BOOLEAN ObservableObject::IsAttached (  Observer *  observer  )  const
 

Returns TRUE, if the Observer is attached.

void ObservableObject::NotifyObservers (   ) 
 

Invokes Observer::OnUpdate(this) for all attached Observers. Call this method when a state of the Observable-Object changes.
